column4: It doesn't look like the machine is actually down - it seems to be routing; some places can still get to it - some places aren't even able to traceroute from their isp at all
Ah cool - I've used that to get me out of holes on machines with Debian where the kernel wouldn't boot it
Wrong, /usr/bin/edit
when I write edit, I mean it as a verb, not a program
apt-file, same as in Debian
apt-cache can never find files in packages
Oh - never used that on debian! I always used the dpkg bot on #debian and the package web pages
someone made a contents search thing, it's linked from the front of the wiki
Damn - it doesn't find my file
Ta - ah, I hadn't grok'd that apt-file has a seperate database and needed an update first
I think there are a lot of people jumping from (standard) debian
yeah
There are some small things - e.g. the graphical login text is very small on 1600x1200 and I can't see any obvious way to change it
the font size should be set in points, ie be physically the same size on any screen
Indeed - although auto detecting DPI is pretty random
sure, the dpi probably requires a question
Hehe - what we need is a dialog with a picture of known coins on them and asking how large they are :-)
haha
Is it realmedia ?
oh, .ram
